00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite - 
00015 // .SECTION Description
00016 // This sub-object is specific to each
00017 // type of volume that needs to be read in.  This can be used
00018 // to clean up the special cases which handle
00019 // volumes of various types, such as dicom, header, etc.  In
00020 // future these things can be moved here.  Each read/write 
00021 // sub-object corresponds to a vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode subclass.
00022 // These subclasses write any needed info in the MRML file.
00023 //
00024 
00025 #ifndef __vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite_h
00026 #define __vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite_h
00027 
00028 #include "vtkObject.h"
00029 #include "vtkSlicer.h"
00030 #include "vtkMrmlVolumeNode.h"
00031 #include "vtkImageSource.h"
00032 
00033 class VTK_SLICER_BASE_EXPORT vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite : public vtkObject
00034 {
00035   public:
00036   static vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite *New();
00037   vtkTypeMacro(vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite,vtkObject);
00038   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00039   
00040   // Return code indicates success (1) or error (0)
00041   virtual int Read(vtkMrmlVolumeNode *node, vtkImageSource **output);
00042   virtual int Write(vtkMrmlVolumeNode *node, vtkImageData *input);
00043 
00044   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00045   // Specifics for reading/writing each type of volume data
00046   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00047 
00048   // Subclasses must fill these in.
00049 
00050 protected:
00051   vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite();
00052   ~vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite();
00053   vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite(const vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite&) {};
00054   void operator=(const vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite&) {};
00055 };
00056 
00057 #endif
